New Records: Cole Palmer became the fifth England player to score his first senior goal for the national team via the penalty spot.
Harry Kane now has 63 goals for his country, the most in Three Lions history, now 10 clear of the second place Wayne Rooney.
Key Match Events: Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a superb volley for the second goal.
Harry Kane scored a third goal for England in scruffy fashion.
Cole Palmer scored his first goal for England via a penalty.
Eberechi Eze had an impressive debut for England.
James Maddison had a close chance to double the Three Lions' lead.
Jarrad Branthwaite received a yellow card for England in his first cap.
Joe Gomez replaced Lewis Dunk, and Ezri Konsa moved into the middle.
Marc Guehi flew into a challenge and received a yellow card.
England dominated the second half, creating a lot of openings and scoring three goals.

The England team was expected to be experimental, with many players looking to make a statement.
Gareth Southgate wanted to use the time to get a clearer picture of the team's fitness and form.

Harry Kane felt it was a good game for England and a good chance to get minutes.
Gareth Southgate had a lot of fresh players to bring in and was happy with the performance.
